channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AK
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AK

item.title: Report X-2024051261
item.description:
Report X-2024051261

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-06T15:13:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-16
  • City: ANC
  • State: AK
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: ALASKA AIRLINES, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Shipment from awb#73181183 got mixed with passenger bags and made its way to ANC baggage claim. It is a yellow cooler tote from Trader Joe's. The bag was retrieved and since it left the secure area, rescreened at ANCFF. CNS requested for it to be physically searched. Upon opening the bag, there were a large amount of nail polish bottles, nail glue, and nail dip powder found in the bag. Shipment flew already IAD-LAX flight 277/ 12May and LAX-ANC flight 193/ 13May.

item.title: Report X-2024051259
item.description:
Report X-2024051259

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-06T15:13:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-12
  • City: ANC
  • State: AK
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: ALASKA AIRLINES, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Customer came in to ship GSX to FAI 2 pcs declared a non-spillable battery in one box. I asked if there were any more batteries in the second box, apart from the first box that contained the non-spill battery. Customer said there was just the one non spillable, and aircraft parts in the other box. He seemed confused by my question and even said just so that we are on the same page. When I went to screen the boxes there indeed was non-spillable battery in one box. But the second box contained a 392Wh lithium-ion battery. This would have been on a passenger aircraft if not discovered.

item.title: Report X-2024050843
item.description:
Report X-2024050843

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-03T15:13:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-26
  • City: ANC
  • State: AK
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: ALASKA AIRLINES, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: X RAYED SHIPMENT. SAW AN OUTLINE THAT APPEARED TO BE A NON SPILLABLE BATTERY. PERFORMED PHYSICAL SEARCH AND CONFIRMED THERE WAS A NON SPILLABLE BATTERY. NO LABELS INDICATING THAT IT IS NONSPILLABLE ON THE OUTSIDE OF THE BOX AND UNDECLARED.
